main_definition: Juvenile refers to something related to young people, especially those who are not yet adults; often used in legal contexts to describe offenders under a certain age.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to or characteristic of youth
meanings_and_examples.example: The juvenile nature of his actions was apparent.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Refers to young people, typically those under the age of 18
meanings_and_examples.example: Juvenile delinquency refers to illegal behavior committed by minors.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A juvenile animal or plant is one that has not yet reached maturity.
meanings_and_examples.example: The zoo's collection of juvenile animals includes several young gorillas and lions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An offender who has committed a crime but is legally considered too young to be tried as an adult
meanings_and_examples.example: He was charged with burglary, but since he was under 18 at the time of the crime, his case was handled in juvenile court.
